title: WCAS HISTORY 392-0-30 Topics In History
topic: Race and Rebellion in Latin America

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is a course about race, which does not exist. More specifically, we will examine the often violent, social construction of difference in Latin America from the 16th century to the present, focusing primarily on 19th- and 20th-century Mexico and Brazil. Furthermore, this course will investigate the innumerable ways that religion, gender, and class inform what it meant to be a "scrambled Indian," to live in a "racial democracy," and to be "Afro-Mexican." Classes will consist of brief lectures and ample time for (semi-)directed discussions.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Two Response Papers (based upon course content), & Research Essay (word count = 2,000)
